description: This trap is sent when the Service Discovery ERM connection fails.
This can occur for a number of reasons, the Virtual Edge may not be
able to successfully establish the connection, the OPEN
message negotiation may fail, the ERM may closed the
connection, the Hold Time may expire, a NOTIFICATION message
may be received, etc.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoSrvDiscErmConnection CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter c 9999 CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity i 1 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerveIndex i 0 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerErmSrvDiscIndex i 1 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerErmSrvDiscRemoteIpAddr s EXAMPLE ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerErmSrvDiscPort u 9999 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoErrorStr s EXAMPLE ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoStatus i 1

description: This is the trap sequence number that increments each
time a trap is sent. It is persistent across resets.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter

description: Severity level of a Cadant trap.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity

description: The index of the Virtual Edge. Although not officially supported, allow a VE for each
of 12 DCAMs.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerveIndex

description: Index of ERM configuration entry.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerErmSrvDiscIndex

description: The ERM remote address. An IPv4 address or hostname is acceptable
as an address.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerErmSrvDiscRemoteIpAddr

description: Contains TCP port value used for DRRP listener/connections.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerErmSrvDiscPort

description: Description of error encountered on the ERM interface.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoErrorStr

description: ERM connection status of E6000.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoStatus

description: This trap is sent when the E6000 detects a problem with
the incoming video stream. This can be a problem parsing a
PAT or PMT in the stream, a jitter buffer underflow or overflow
non-MPEG data on the stream.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoStreamFailure CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter c 9999 CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity i 1 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerveIndex i 0 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpDestUdpPort u 9999 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpDestIpAddr s EXAM ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpSrcIpAddr s EXAM ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoErrorStr s EXAMPLE

description: This is the trap sequence number that increments each
time a trap is sent. It is persistent across resets.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter

description: Severity level of a Cadant trap.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity

description: The index of the Virtual Edge. Although not officially supported, allow a VE for each
of 12 DCAMs.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerveIndex

description: The destination UDP Port of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified QAM
Channel.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpDestUdpPort

description: The DEST IP address of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified
QAM Channel.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpDestIpAddr

description: The SRC IP address of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified
QAM Channel.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpSrcIpAddr

description: Description of error encountered on the ERM interface.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoErrorStr

description: This trap is sent when the E6000 detects a problem with
forwarding an incoming stream to a QAM channel. This can
be as a result of the UDP port being blocked, there is no
matching UDP port on an IS QAM channel, the potential
of creating a program number conflict on the QAM channel,
the program number limit has been reached on the QAM
channel, etc.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoServiceFailure CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter c 9999 CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity i 1 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerveIndex i 0 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpDestUdpPort u 9999 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpDestIpAddr s EXAM ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpSrcIpAddr s EXAM ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervStreamProgIndex u 9999 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoErrorStr s EXAMPLE

description: This is the trap sequence number that increments each
time a trap is sent. It is persistent across resets.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter

description: Severity level of a Cadant trap.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity

description: The index of the Virtual Edge. Although not officially supported, allow a VE for each
of 12 DCAMs.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerveIndex

description: The destination UDP Port of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified QAM
Channel.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpDestUdpPort

description: The DEST IP address of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified
QAM Channel.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpDestIpAddr

description: The SRC IP address of the incoming TS being mapped to the specified
QAM Channel.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervUdpIpSrcIpAddr

description: The Program Number for this program within the associated
Transport Stream.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cervStreamProgIndex

description: Description of error encountered on the ERM interface.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoErrorStr

description: This trap is sent when the E6000 detects oversubscription
on a QAM channel and has taken corrective action.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoQamOversubscription CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter c 9999 CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity i 1 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerveIndex i 0 IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoErrorStr s EXAMPLE

description: This is the trap sequence number that increments each
time a trap is sent. It is persistent across resets.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapCounter

description: Severity level of a Cadant trap.
variables.name: CADANT-CMTS-EQUIPMENT-MIB::trapSeverity

description: The index of the Virtual Edge. Although not officially supported, allow a VE for each
of 12 DCAMs.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerveIndex

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: Description of error encountered on the ERM interface.
variables.name: ARRIS-CER-VIDEO-MIB::cerVideoErrorStr
